p: Regarding in vivo studies, Erdemoglu et al. showed that ethanol extract of the leaves of J. regia delivered orally to mice has anti-inflammatory effects at 500 mg/kg as determined by the carrageenan-induced paw edema test [ 78]. When the methanol extracts of the septa of J. regia was tested for oral acute toxicity and sub-chronic toxicity in rats, no toxicity was detected and the lethal dose was higher than the maximum concentration tested, i.e., 5000 mg/kg [ 79]
